body:
I can reproduce this problem. This is because on M1 Macs there's a more stringent codesigning requirement, and I don't think the released Alacritty.app is signed properly:

```
$ codesign -d -vvv -r - /Applications/Alacritty.app 
Executable=/Applications/Alacritty.app/Contents/MacOS/alacritty
Identifier=alacritty-4588e9d6612605a7
Format=app bundle with Mach-O universal (x86_64 arm64)
CodeDirectory v=20400 size=30419 flags=0x20002(adhoc,linker-signed) hashes=947+0 location=embedded
Hash type=sha256 size=32
CandidateCDHash sha256=dee73bbb5c1966563ad32013da53edf3d64995ce
CandidateCDHashFull sha256=dee73bbb5c1966563ad32013da53edf3d64995ce9a1c6497e2448129cb832527
Hash choices=sha256
CMSDigest=dee73bbb5c1966563ad32013da53edf3d64995ce9a1c6497e2448129cb832527
CMSDigestType=2
CDHash=dee73bbb5c1966563ad32013da53edf3d64995ce
Signature=adhoc
Info.plist=not bound
TeamIdentifier=not set
Sealed Resources=none
/Applications/Alacritty.app: code object is not signed at all
```

Building from source still works though.

Could someone with an M1 try [Alacritty.app.tar.gz](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/7977854/Alacritty.app.tar.gz)? This is signed locally with my macbook, if the M1 accepts unverified signatures we can at least add that to our makefile and have things self-signed by CI then.
I had the same issues on MacOS 12.2 and just tried your build, @chrisduerr. It works fine. MacOS asks once for the permission and afterwards access is allowed as expected.

> Could someone with an M1 try [Alacritty.app.tar.gz](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/7977854/Alacritty.app.tar.gz)? This is signed locally with my macbook, if the M1 accepts unverified signatures we can at least add that to our makefile and have things self-signed by CI then.

Looks a little better...
```
$ codesign -d -vvv -r - ~/Downloads/Alacritty.app
Executable=/Users/dongcarl/Downloads/Alacritty.app/Contents/MacOS/alacritty
Identifier=io.alacritty
Format=app bundle with Mach-O universal (x86_64 arm64)
CodeDirectory v=20400 size=29733 flags=0x2(adhoc) hashes=923+3 location=embedded
Hash type=sha256 size=32
CandidateCDHash sha1=daa279e35fca673607443f3ce9fda99748bc8b7d
CandidateCDHashFull sha1=daa279e35fca673607443f3ce9fda99748bc8b7d
CandidateCDHash sha256=ddb15415c4b6ca95a6dabb601eb38fc70231be34
CandidateCDHashFull sha256=ddb15415c4b6ca95a6dabb601eb38fc70231be34f521360c2df287fa75bbc2fb
Hash choices=sha1,sha256
CMSDigest=e907f8d85e6b175442bb9937606f5f33a9d015c247ab602de1a34c3796334ba9
CMSDigestType=2
CDHash=ddb15415c4b6ca95a6dabb601eb38fc70231be34
Signature=adhoc
Info.plist entries=25
TeamIdentifier=not set
Sealed Resources version=2 rules=13 files=8
# designated => cdhash H"daa279e35fca673607443f3ce9fda99748bc8b7d" or cdhash H"ddb15415c4b6ca95a6dabb601eb38fc70231be34" or cdhash H"8b0e2825aea4c4e1c52eefe0560051d69aada92c" or cdhash H"a3b012e1cdf37f2e0e61ea1e761a9a677dbd529b"
```

> Looks a little better...

Did you actually run that on M1 without any issues, or did you just check the codesign results?

@chrisduerr .. I had the same exact problem. I used the version you attached, and it does seem to suppress the repeated message about accessing files. I was chatting with Apple support wrt this and ofc they were clueless. Thank you!!

> Could someone with an M1 try [Alacritty.app.tar.gz](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/7977854/Alacritty.app.tar.gz)? This is signed locally with my macbook, if the M1 accepts unverified signatures we can at least add that to our makefile and have things self-signed by CI then.

This seems to solve the issue üëç  The permission are now remembered!

I had this exact issue and signed Alacritty myself:

1. Generate a certificate for code signing: follow this [documentation from Apple](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Security/Conceptual/CodeSigningGuide/Procedures/Procedures.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40005929-CH4-SW1)
2. Sign the Alacrity binary: `codesign -s <identity> /Applications/Alacritty.app/Contents/MacOS/alacritty` (replace `<identity>` with the one provided in the certificate.

Since everything works as intended :)

issue.title: Fix repeated permission requests on M1 macs
issue.body:
This adds a codesign step to our makefile build which should
automatically sign the application and resolve the issues on M1 macs
where Alacritty constantly requests permissions.

Since self-signing does still seem to fix this issue after sharing the
resulting `Alacritty.app` with other M1 macs, the binary produced by our
release build should also be fixed automatically.

Fixes #5840.

body:
this worked for me too without generating the signature
```
sudo codesign --force --deep --sign - /Applications/Alacritty.app
```

I had the exact same issue. Running `codesign` didn't help (it returns this error `/Applications/Alacritty.app: resource fork, Finder information, or similar detritus not allowed`)
I downloaded the [v0.10.1](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.10.1) version and everything is working now!
Allow `Full Disk Access` for `Alacritty` work for me
> > > Allow `Full Disk Access` for `Alacritty` work for me This did not change anything for me
> > > > Allow `Full Disk Access` for `Alacritty` work for me > > This did not change anything for me same here :/

> I had the exact same issue. Running `codesign` didn't help (it returns this error `/Applications/Alacritty.app: resource fork, Finder information, or similar detritus not allowed`) I downloaded the [v0.10.1](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.10.1) version and everything is working now!

Apparently downloading the v0.10.1 from the github releases page seems to have worked for me. (shouldn't this be the same build as the one from the alacritty website ü§î ?)
